pericope_titles.title: The Reservoir of Creation: New Order
pericope_titles.theme: God, through His almighty power, created all things orderly and complete, resting on the seventh day to sanctify it.

pericope_titles.title: Eden: The Sovereign's Test & Labor
pericope_titles.theme: The Lord God formed man in His own image and gave him dominion over the garden, with the privilege and responsibility of stewardship.

pericope_titles.title: The Golden Chain Broken: Instant Surety
pericope_titles.theme: Man's disobedience brought death and judgment, yet God promised that the Seed of the woman would crush the serpent's head.

pericope_titles.title: Succession of Falls: Cain's Brand
pericope_titles.theme: Cain's offering was rejected because it lacked the blood sacrifice that God requires; in anger he murdered his brother Abel.

pericope_titles.title: The Longevity of the First Age
pericope_titles.theme: The patriarchs lived in great longevity; Enoch alone walked with God and was translated, while corruption increased among men.

pericope_titles.title: The Great Art Perishes: Noah's Ark
pericope_titles.theme: The earth became full of violence and corruption through the perversion of God's gifts; God commanded Noah to build an ark for preservation.

pericope_titles.title: The Sign of the Bow: Encompassing Love
pericope_titles.theme: The flood waters prevailed over all the earth; God remembered Noah and set the rainbow in the sky as a covenant sign of mercy.

pericope_titles.title: Accountability & Divine Sovereignty
pericope_titles.theme: God decreed that man's blood shall be shed for the shedding of blood; His dominion extends over all nations and peoples.

pericope_titles.title: Babel: Confederacy of Rebellion
pericope_titles.theme: Mankind united in pride to build a city and tower against God; the Lord confounded their tongues and scattered them abroad.

pericope_titles.title: The Call: Separation and Naked Promise
pericope_titles.theme: The Lord called Abram to depart from his kindred and country and follow nothing but His promise, establishing him as the father of the faithful.

pericope_titles.title: Lot's Choice: Temporal vs. Spiritual Advantage
pericope_titles.theme: Lot chose the well-watered plain of the Jordan, not knowing his choice would lead him and his family toward Sodom's destruction.

pericope_titles.title: Melchizedek: Christ's Representative
pericope_titles.theme: Melchizedek, King of Salem and Priest of the Most High God, blessed Abram and received tithes, foreshadowing Christ's priesthood.

pericope_titles.title: Covenant of Pieces: Delayed Iniquity
pericope_titles.theme: God made a covenant with Abram in a vision, revealing that his seed shall be as the stars, though the Amorites' cup of iniquity is not yet full.

pericope_titles.title: Hagar: Human Schemes vs. Divine Plan
pericope_titles.theme: Sarai gave Hagar to Abram according to man's wisdom; Ishmael was born, yet God's covenant was sealed with Isaac through circumcision.

pericope_titles.title: Hospitality and the Boundary of Mercy
pericope_titles.theme: The Lord appeared to Abraham; he interceded for Sodom, yet the city had transgressed the boundary of God's mercy through deliberate wickedness.

pericope_titles.title: Lot's Paralysis and Escape
pericope_titles.theme: The angels made haste to bring Lot forth from Sodom's judgment; Isaac was born to Abraham, the promised heir of the covenant.

pericope_titles.title: The Akedah: Figure of Self-Denial
pericope_titles.theme: God commanded Abraham to offer Isaac; this trial revealed the magnitude of God's love and the completeness of faith required of the believer.

pericope_titles.title: Final Rest: Successor Secured
pericope_titles.theme: Sarah passed from this life; Abraham sent his servant to secure Rebekah as a bride, ensuring the covenant line's continuation.

pericope_titles.title: Esau's Appetite: The Despised Birthright
pericope_titles.theme: Esau, overcome by hunger from the field, sold his birthright for a meal, despising the sacred privilege for a moment's gratification.

pericope_titles.title: Jacob's Ladder: Bridging the Gulf
pericope_titles.theme: Jacob saw a vision of a ladder reaching to heaven with angels ascending and descending, Christ being the bridge between man and God.

pericope_titles.title: Laban's Artifice and Polygamy's Wrong
pericope_titles.theme: Jacob served Laban and was deceived with Leah before receiving Rachel; the multiplication of wives brought contention and sorrow.

pericope_titles.title: Peniel: Victory Through Self-Surrender
pericope_titles.theme: Jacob wrestled with a Man until daybreak and prevailed; through this humiliation and self-surrender, he received the name Israel.

pericope_titles.title: Humbled by Wrong: Purification
pericope_titles.theme: Dinah was defiled by Shechem; Jacob's family was humbled and required to put away their strange gods before God's covenant was renewed.

pericope_titles.title: Esau's Climax and Closure
pericope_titles.theme: The genealogy of Esau is recorded, marking the rejected line; through Jacob alone the covenant promise continues unto all generations.

pericope_titles.title: The Rejection: Joseph as Christ Type
pericope_titles.theme: Joseph was hated by his brethren and sold into captivity; he foreshadowed Christ rejected by His own and delivered to death.

pericope_titles.title: Integrity Under Siege: Joseph's Fortification
pericope_titles.theme: Joseph resisted the temptation of Potiphar's wife, his early impressions having fortified his heart against the enticements of the flesh.

pericope_titles.title: Prison Discipline: Prepared for Exaltation
pericope_titles.theme: The Lord was with Joseph in prison; through affliction and obedience, He prepared Joseph to govern and teach others wisdom.

pericope_titles.title: Elevation: Man in Whom the Spirit of God Is
pericope_titles.theme: Pharaoh recognized in Joseph a man upon whom the Spirit of God rested; he exalted him above all the land of Egypt.

pericope_titles.title: Testing the Brethren and Reconciliation
pericope_titles.theme: Joseph tested his brethren to bring them to confession and repentance; God's purpose overrode their evil to bring salvation to many.

pericope_titles.title: Vayechi: The Enduring Promise
pericope_titles.theme: Jacob blessed his sons with his dying breath; the scepter and lawgiver shall not depart from Judah until the coming of Shiloh.
